posts.post_content:
Epic art, Chippy couldn't have done any better on this one.  
  
When you look at finishers like this (for control or ramp or whatever you're playing) you look for a few things. 1) Effectiveness and 2) Resiliency. Akroma's 6/6 flying first strike trample haste vigilance takes care of the effectiveness, and protection from black and red gives her a considerable amount of resiliency, considering a lot of creature removal comes in black and red.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: @raverboy1123 - Look again, the [Reiver Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reiver Demon) doesn't deal damage to anyone or anything when it comes into play, rather it destroys, and since it doesn't specifically target, creatures like [Akroma, Angel of Wrath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Akroma, Angel of Wrath) WOULD perish to it. If it didn't as you have stated, then other creatures like [Progenitus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Progenitus) wouldn't die from a [Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God), even though Wizards has clearly stated that it can due to the effect that [Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God) gives to the entire battlefield. Much like the [Reiver Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reiver Demon)'s ability.
posts.html:
@raverboy1123 - Look again, the Reiver Demon doesn't deal damage to anyone or anything when it comes into play, rather it destroys, and since it doesn't specifically target, creatures like Akroma, Angel of Wrath WOULD perish to it. If it didn't as you have stated, then other creatures like Progenitus wouldn't die from a Wrath of God, even though Wizards has clearly stated that it can due to the effect that Wrath of God gives to the entire battlefield. Much like the Reiver Demon's ability.

Posted By: Jedijoe (6/8/2010 10:51:14 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The art for this is perfect, and I'll tell you why.  
It depicts Akroma at her very essence.  
Chippy's captured a perfect balance of flawless beauty and inhuman monster.  
  
[Ixidor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=40578) modeled her after his dead lover, so she's got a bit of Mary Sue-level of beauty going on. Pretty face, great curves, midnight black hair, shamelessly stripperiffic outfit.  
She's also a soulless killing machine. Which is also pulled off very well. The liquid paper white skin. Cold emotionless face. Dead, empty eyes.
posts.html:
The art for this is perfect, and I'll tell you why.
It depicts Akroma at her very essence.
Chippy's captured a perfect balance of flawless beauty and inhuman monster.

Ixidor modeled her after his dead lover, so she's got a bit of Mary Sue-level of beauty going on. Pretty face, great curves, midnight black hair, shamelessly stripperiffic outfit.
She's also a soulless killing machine. Which is also pulled off very well. The liquid paper white skin. Cold emotionless face. Dead, empty eyes.

Posted By: HairlessThoctar (7/12/2010 4:36:00 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This is a very overrated card. I am not against eight mana cards in general, if you cheat them out or ramp up to them, they can be very effective threats. However, If you are going to do all that for one card, it should come much closer to ensuring you victory. A good finisher, what this card should be, gives you a massive threat that has to be dealt with, at the same time as making sure your opponent's threats are stopped (See Gisela, Stormtide Leviathan, and Elesh Norn). This acts as a powerful beater, but its abilities only affect itself, and don't stop your opponent at all. If you haven't lost any life, it takes four hits from Akroma to kill you, and if you had a victory plan set up before this is played, you will probably still win. Gisela, on the other hand, is in my opinion the best angel in magic, because it is the kind of card that lets you win even if you seemed to have no chance otherwise. Don't get me wrong, this is still a good card, and i expect it to be played in some co... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: nunzioni (7/26/2012 7:03:47 AM)
Rating:

@raverboy112 - SolidSoldier and subsequently Jedijoe are both right.

Pro something means it cannot be targeted by spells or abilities of the appropriate protection, blocked (in most cases at least, except such cases when a creature is put into play already blocking, such as one from the new schemes in archenemy.) and all damage dealt to it would be prevented with exception of other rare cases such as me attacking with an Excruciator and you block it with Akroma, it would kill the Akroma even though she has pro red. Mass removal though, does not deal damage, nor does it target, thus getting around protection and killing Akroma, if in fact the Reiver Demon was cast from a player's hand. xD

Yay bandwagons! also, it's spelled geniuses**
